title: Lady Amelia Windsor pulls silly faces while strolling in pink cords through Notting Hill
text:
Lady Amelia Windsor was dubbed ‘the most beautiful Royal’ when she wore head-to-toe Chanel at the Queen’s 90th birthday celebrations back in 2016.

But she may have betrayed her sobriquet as she strolled through the streets of Notting Hill last week wearing rather unfortunate trousers and pulling a series of silly faces.

The 24-year-old granddaughter of the Duke of Kent wore a pair of pink cords of the kind often seen on male toffs from south of the river.

But as Lady A is a stalwart of the Ladbroke Grove-dwelling posh set, at least she has given them an edgy twist.

Lady Amelia Windsor was dubbed ‘the most beautiful Royal’ when she wore head-to-toe Chanel at the Queen’s 90th birthday celebrations back in 2016. But she may have betrayed her sobriquet as she strolled through the streets of Notting Hill last week wearing rather unfortunate trousers...

... while also pulling silly faces. The 24-year-old granddaughter of the Duke of Kent wore a pair of pink cords of the kind often seen on male toffs from south of the river

Lady A arrives at St Paul's Cathedral for a national service of thanksgiving to celebrate the 90th birthday of the Queen three years ago

The new web sensation? Caring's loo!

I’ve lost count of the grand openings I have been to but last week was the most bizarre of all… the unveiling of a loo.

This wasn’t any old lavatory: it’s colourful restaurateur Richard Caring’s new mosiac-clad bathroom in Mayfair, which was ceremoniously opened two days before the new restaurant it serves.

This loo’s so posh, Posh Spice ‘christened’ it at the party.

Opening night: Matteo Caring cuts the ribbon for the new restaurant with parents Richard and Patricia, and sister Isabella

Caring is capitalising on a new social phenomenon – the ‘loo selfie’ – which has been a hit for his club Annabel’s.

Women queue to take pictures in the Pink Powder Room and show them off on Instagram.

This new loo has been designed to break the internet with a rainforest theme, four-million pieces of mosaic glass and a crocodile-shaped basin carved from green onyx.

Last night, Richard’s son Matteo, five, cut the ribbon for the restaurant named after him.

Crush of the week... India Windsor-Clive

I’m smitten by the new Queen of Notting Hill, India Windsor-Clive. She’s taken the crown from Lily Allen – and she’s dating the pop star’s ex-husband, Sam Cooper, too.

India, 31, and posh builder Sam, 41, have made West London their stamping ground.

I’m smitten by the new Queen of Notting Hill, India Windsor-Clive. She's taken the crown from Lily Allen – and she's dating the pop star's ex-husband, Sam Cooper, too

India is the achingly cool daughter of the Earl of Plymouth and calls herself ‘an art director, set dresser and creative consultant’.

She’s a descendant of Clive of India, who ran most of India in the 18th Century, but the Windsor side of her family are not Royal.

And I’m assured her first name is not just a tribute to her famous ancestor – it’s practically a legal requirement to be called India if you’re a young woman in Notting Hill!
